name: Sheraton Greensboro at Four Seasons

reviews.title: Staff, manager rude
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a convention in February. Despite asking for an early check in, we were denied a room until 3:00 on the nose. I even mentioned that I was a Starwood Preferred Guest and the manager shrugged his shoulders. Therefore, my husband and I were stuck in the lobby for approximately four hours before we were permitted to check in. Staff told me that they would not call me or open up a room until exactly 3:00 pm. Furthermore, this hotel seemed unable to provide adequate taxi service. The bellmen wouldn't help and it took about a half hour of standing in the freezing cold to get a taxi ride from the hotel. The food for the convention was overcooked and on average, substandard. I will not return.

i have stayed at different hotels in greensboro many times i have realtives who live up there but always stay at hotels due to no room at their houes. I have tried the marriott ok but tired and the best western not bad and other hotels as well but i always find myself coming back to the sheraton. yes it is the pricey hotel in town along with the embassy suites but the location and first class amenities and nice clean rooms keep me returning. it is truely in a class by itself when it comes to other chain hotels around there. It is first class all they way but the prices of the rooms can get enormous depending on the time of the year you go. so check on line before go so you want be surprised!! you could pay as much as 200 or more if something big like furniture market is in town of course asssuming you can even get a room during then. i usually pay around 130 for a room during normal convention times. i have paid as liittle as 110 or 118 during below normal busy times. you just need to check first. one secret though is to ask for a room in tower 2 or the new tower as i call it. the older tower and west wing is not nearly as opoulant as the newer tower 2. if you can get tower 2 on a high floor. it has one of the most beautiful night scenes you will ever see from the huge picure windows in the rooms. dont get a king room though in the new tower because it is much smaller rooms. but if you take my advice get a 2 bedded room in the newer tower 2 with a high floor and you will not be dissapointed or so i think. and i am pretty pickey when it comes to hotels that meet my expectations.
reviews.title: A great hotel but pricey sometimes

reviews.text: I spent three nights at this hotel for a conference. Later in the same week I stayed at a Sheraton In Dallas and let me just say the Greensboro location looks likes the Westin in comparison. This review will appeal more to SPG awards members as I have no complaints about the hotel or the accomodations as they were more than adequate.Overall, the hotel is nice, it is very large and rooms were clean. They have upgraded their bedding and it is very plush. My issue really stems from front desk staff not acknowledging my preferred gold status. (I will say, in general every Sheraton that I have stayed at this has been a problem.). I was checked into a tiny, tiny King room and the bed was the same width of the room save 2 feet on either size. I am supposed to be upgraded if anything is available. After going down to the front desk 3 times, the manager switched my room to a very large room with two double beds. Other than this incident everything during my stay was fine, not to mention the free internet access in your room!
reviews.title: Better than most

reviews.text: I spent five days at a reunion held in the hotel. Check-in was effortless and staff quite pleasant. While there were three other conventions and soccer team there at the same time,hotel was large enough not run into other groups or feel closed in.Had some of the best pastry at the coffee shop! Mall across the parking lot has everything you could want from dollar stores to upscale items. There's even a post office in the mall that's open 7 days a week. great if you buy too much and need to ship things home! The room was quite nice and the bed very comfortable.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality

likes.disliked: — not enough toiletries in the bathroom

reviews.text: views from the rooms are not very pictureque but,you do see the city from the higher floors. Food served for the reunion luncheon and banquet was delicious with well thought out selections!
reviews.title: Fine hotel for nights stay

reviews.text: This hotel did not live up to Sheraton standards. In all of my travels (I stay at many Starwood properties), I have never stayed in a room where my toiletries were already used. My lotion bottle was half empty, and the tissue box had tissues stuffed into it from a different box.
reviews.title: Does not live up to Sheraton standards

reviews.text: The front desk staff was not friendly and seemed very tired. The elevators were slow.
reviews.title: Almost but still short

reviews.text: I attended for a conference and when I asked for a vegetarian meal at a luncheon (that had been pre-ordered) the waitstaff looked very confused and finally brought me something after a 10-minute wait. The wrap was loaded with mayonnaise and I couldn't eat it. I had tried to simply ask for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich but my request was ignored. I left the banquet and paid $4.00 for a peanut butter sandwich off the children's menu in the restaurant and brought it back to the banquet.
reviews.title: Adequate at best....

reviews.text: When I asked for a standard Sheraton evaluation form, I was told that the hotel was privately owned and they had their own evaluation form. Of course it did not have much space on it for me to write my comments, but I did as well as I could and mailed it to them.
reviews.title: Way too crowded
Honesty
reviews.text: The nice thing about the hotel staff was the security staff. They were friendly and helpful and always answered my questions (I had many because the hotel is so big!).

We were ar the Sheraton for 3 days of meetings. The rooms were great, very very clean and overall it was a good stay. Every staff member was gracious and helpful. The business services area and internet access were easy to use. There are lots of places to dine out within walking distance (try The Bone Fish Grill) and several bars/dinning areas in the hotel. There's even a mall nearby in case you forgot something or want to bring home a gift.
reviews.title: Great for a business meeting

likes.liked: — The room and staff were excellent.
likes.disliked: — The main dinning room was closed for renovations but there were lots of other places to dine.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for an annual company meeting. We had our meeting in the conference rooms there. The room I stayed in was clean and comfortable. Everyone was very helpful. I did not have the time to enjoy all their facilities, but I would recommend it to any one of any age.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

likes.liked: — Convenience. I really liked being located in the same location where my business meeting was held.
likes.disliked: — Directions within the hotel. At check in I was given a rather long way to get to my room.

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: We stayed here for a three day seminar. This place has the best amenities for a city hotel. Really enjoyed my comfy bed and the space in the room. Everything was clean and in place. This hotel has a little of everything. Service was excellent. The food was good and the club is alot of fun also even if you are not into the club scene.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A plus is the Four Seasons mall about 300 yards from the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: Superb service from checkin to leaving the parking lot. They aim to please at this hotel.
reviews.title: Just Ok,management is not friendly

likes.disliked: — The management was not customer friendly and some were very rude.

reviews.title: A Great, Relaxing Weekend!
reviews.text: My Husband and I spent this past weekend at the Sheraton, Gastonia NC.

It is a beautiful hotel, conveniently located. Our room was convenient, easy to get to, clean, plenty of room and the bed was so comfortable! We attended a wedding reception held at the hotel and the food was absolutely delicious. We ate at several of the other resturants in the hotel and the food was good there also, can't wait until the next opportunity to go there again.
reviews.title: A nice surprise
Relaxing Week
reviews.text: As a SPG Platinum member, I was pleasantly surprised with the VALUE that I recieved from this hotel. For $89, I had a room that was on par with a Hyatt or Lowes hotel. A great central location with amazing staff and service, I will definatly stay again!

description: 1000 Guestroom hotel with four affordable restaurants, four bars, Sheraton fitness center, in/outdoor pool. Adjacent to a 200 store mall with 20 restaurants. Golf and spa facilities available at sister property Grandover Resort with complimentary transportation. Airport transportation complimentary, UPS Store and Hertz on site.
